meanings.definition: To restore or renew the silver coating on an object.
meanings.sent1: I need to resilver this old mirror to make it look new again.
meanings.sent2: After cleaning the silverware, I will resilver it for a sparkling finish.
meanings.sent3: The wizard used a magical spell to resilver the tarnished crown.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to resilver the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to resilver the surface of the lake, creating a dazzling reflection.

meanings.definition: To make something shiny or lustrous again.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler will resilver the bracelet to make it gleam once more.
meanings.sent2: Using a special polish, she was able to resilver the antique vase beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The car wash service promised to resilver your vehicle to a showroom shine.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to resilver the dull mood of the party.
meanings.sent5: The rain shower helped to resilver the leaves, making the whole garden sparkle in the sunlight.
